e4: Adopting the new policy ensures the company reports earnings without bias, aligning with ethical standards and reducing exposure to legal risks. It fosters greater transparency and trust with investors. While some confusion may arise initially, over time, clear communication can help investors adjust to the unbiased reporting and maintain confidence in the company.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and integrity, ensuring financial reports reflect true company performance without intentional bias or manipulation. It should protect all investors, including less sophisticated ones, from misinformation and provide clear, understandable communication about any changes. Additionally, it should comply with legal standards to avoid regulatory issues.
e6: I would ask how the management plans to communicate the policy change to all investor segments to ensure understanding. Additionally, what measures are being put in place to monitor the impact on stock price and investor relations following the change? How will they address potential investor confusion or misinterpretation?
